H0.text: The gas is more dense than the air, which allows the teacher to pour CO₂ gas over a candle during the demonstration to put out the flame.

H1.text: The gas being more visible than the air is the physical property that allows the teacher to pour CO₂ over a candle and put out the flame during a demonstration.

H2.text: The gas smells different from the air is the physical property that allows the teacher to pour CO₂ over a candle, extinguishing the flame during the demonstration.

H3.text: The gas evaporates faster than the air is the physical property that allows the teacher to pour CO₂ over a candle to put out the flame during the demonstration.

A4.text: He observed that the fixed air was denser than air and supported neither flame nor animal life.
